alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:12AM EST until December 20 at 3:16AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Pompton River...including Pompton Plains...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pompton River at Pompton Plains. * WHEN...From this morning to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. At 18.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Shady Street becomes impassable and blocks Roosevelt and Shady Streets. Oakwood at Shady Street becomes impassable. The first evacuations begin. Flooding occurs on West View Road and the Lower Riverview community areas of Wayne. At 18.5 feet, Route 23, North and South, is impassable and closed. At 19.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in low lying areas of Wayne, Pequannock and Pompton Lakes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Monday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.9 feet on 10/09/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 16.4 Mon 7 am 18.0 14.7 18.4 7pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM EST.
